reviews.review_text: Love the food, great taste and beautiful presentation!! It is a bit too noisy for us but we can tell it is a very popular place for a good reason. My husband usually doesn t have dessert. I ordered the olive oil cake, he shared half of it, it was so good!! We will definitely be back for more!

So happy we found this restaurant! Large selection of vegetarian dishes and sea food, delicious food! Especially loved the halibut and the vegetarian pasta. Also the fries are delicious. Service was friendly and attentive. Only note is it s REALLY loud inside, we couldn t hear each other speaking (even the young ones;). I recommend sitting outside. Overall great experience
Amazing food, everything I tried was delicious. Cant even pick a favorite item. Oysters, mussels, sable fish, salmon tasted all very fresh and prepared excellently.
The portions were pretty small but the food was good. The burrata was SO GOOD. If you like a more lively atmosphere sit inside, we chose the patio because it was more intimate.

Fresh ingredients but portions are bit small. Came here for our first dinner during our visit in Vancouver on a Friday night. The place was fully booked the only place available for us was in the heated patio area. The patio areas had plenty of heat lamps and the place was fully closed off so you won t need to worry about rain or snow (we were here during March and it actually snowed during our dinner!) The food was pretty good, we ordered tiger shrimp cocktails, grilled oysters, assorted sashimi platter, seared scallops and a bowl of clams. Our favourite was the seared scallops hands down. We also orders some vegetable dish and they were amazing too! The beets with avocado and warm goat cheese was out of this world! The portion was kind of small so consider yourself warned. But the quality was certainly worthy of the price tag. Would come back again!

I did have a hand in building this place, and I do know the owners and chefs..... but that doesnt influence my review of this amazing local tapas restaurant. Quite a varied selection and fresh sheet that is updated so frequently, dare I say daily?!  I recently returned here for the first time since covid with my parents who are exceptionally picky eaters.  We ordered about six to seven plates between the three of us and we were stuffed with the lightest freshest and tastiest foods that their spanish cuisine has to offer. (All with the West coast flare). Oh, and there is an outdoor (but enclosed) patio that makes it feel like a bistro in California. 9/10 would highly recommend, and it could be your new favorite regular place! **Reservations can be very difficult

Oddfish was quite the experience. I had one of the best meals I think Ill ever have. I went with a party of four and we were all able to share, it was wonderful. I need to express how fresh and creative their menu is - especially when you realize it is all based on what comes in from that days catch. The octopus carpaccio, seared scallops, and the sole were divine. I can recommend all of those plus the mussels, though I have a feeling whatever you order here will end up being good. The one negative I would have is the price point if not for the fact I think the experience was well worth it. We ended up spending around $100 per person this meal.

Not many places like this around. Everything from the water to espresso and dessert was excellent. Best olives, oysters, and fries I ve ever had. The raw fish platter was amazing and the deserts were satisfying. Presentation and timing were perfect. Scott was a charming, competent, and helpful server who made the experience whole for us. The serving sizes are not especially large but the flavor is worth the prices. El Popo cocktail was a unique spin on a margarita that was excellently balanced. Couldn t recommend more.
Seafood lover s paradise. The muscles and fries were some of the best I ve ever had. Our server helped with some recommendations and answered any questions we had about the menu in depth.

Gonna go with 4.5 here... Oddfish is a super unique place based on the fact its completely pescatarian. Situated in a quaint little neighborhood, Oddfish has a lot of character and its not the atmosphere that lends to it, its the food! We had a selection of delicious dishes: scallops, a sole picatta, an amazing burrata, and we had to throw some fries in there as well. We were hesitant about the Picatta but its a best seller and was very flavorful. Scallops again are exceptionally delicious but a smaller serving as was the burratta. Understand that the portions arent the largest at Oddfish, but they make up for it in taste. Service was good. Not too overbearing and knowledgeable with respect to the menu. Our guy made a few excellent suggestions that we appreciated. If youre interested in a menu centered entirely on seafood and fish, there arent many places better than Oddfish in Vancouver

One of my favorite casual share plate restaurants in Vancouver. The food is always amazing, and its a great selection of fresh seafood and vegetable dishes. The drinks were a tad pricey, but I feel the food was very reasonably priced considering the quality and creativity of the dishes. The service is also amazing. The last time we were there the server for our section was super slammed but never let stress show. The manager(I presume) jumped in occasionally and the two made a great tag team. I always have a great experience whenever I come here!

This place is getting on my top-3 eat-out spots list in Vancouver. Everything was on a pretty high level, Richard, our waiter did his job brilliantly, he was very attentive and his sense of humor made our evening a bit brighter. The restaurants chef is also on the right spot, dishes look like a masterpiece and taste delicious, thank you for that pleasure. Smoked salmon toast and the oysters were my absolute favorites that evening. There were a couple of things that could be improved though: the water glasses look is not really nice, they look old like with scratches and salty traces from a dishwasher. We don t drink alcohol so we had to use those glasses whole evening. I really liked the smoked salmon toast and asked for another one, but second time the toast itself was badly burnt. But Richard made things right by saying that he was sorry and we won t be charged for this one, he also offered to bring some bread so we could trade it with burnt toast, thanks! But putting the toast like that on the plate in the first place is not really nice. Overall it s a really nice spot and we definitely coming back! Thanks Oddfish!

The servers were prompt and very comfortably professional. Even though it was a super busy evening, our server, Ashley, took time to get to know us and talk to us about their menu. Their vongole & prawn diavolo spaghetti dishes were amazing, and I like the overall vibe of the restaurant, energetic & vibrant. Strongly recommend for a nice dine out place in Kits area. It would be about $50/person for a shared appy, dish & drink.

This was an incredible restaurant with fresh and flavorful seafood!  I really appreciated the small portions... Much better to have small amounts of delicious food than a large amount of mediocre food that I would feel obligated to finish. Everything we ordered was mouthwatering; the highlight was the mixed ceviche.  I ordered potato wrapped halibut and my wife ordered the branzino. Both dishes were very good.  Cocktails were well made, even when I requested something not on the menu.  Service was awesome, staff was attentive but not excessive.  Didnt rush us at all.  This is a place well definitely be returning to!

We had a great time exploring the dishes here. The sashimi tasting plate was was very good. The scallop we had was too salty in the first place, but they fixed it for us. The beats salad is also tasty.

Cozy ambiance inside and perfect patio for nice days. Baked oysters, crudo and burrata were favorites, but everything was excellent. Nice Sancerre wine paring recommendation. Highly recommended if youre in Vancouver.

The pan seared scallops were fantastic. Perfect crust on both sides, and cooked perfectly. Brussel sprouts were also very tasty, with a nice mild spicy kick while being loaded with a mountain of parmesan, slightly warmed and stretchy from being shaved right on top of the parmesan.

Probably the best meal Ive had Im some time. Absolutely loved Oddfish for the food, atmosphere and service. The ceviche was sublime, burrata was amazing and the fish mains and sides were all excellent. Yum!

I ve never felt the need to write a restaurant review before, but this place deserves one. I honestly can t believe it doesn t have more rave reviews. Every dish was delicious - our favourite dish was probably the perch. Our server walked us through the menu and was also super attentive. Just keep in mind everything is a pretty small, so make every bite count!

Always amazing. Since theyve opened we have been here 6-7 times already. Ruby trout is so juicy and perfectly cooked, oysters are always perfect, fresh, crisp, and clean. The citrus salad is refreshing and simple. Whole seabass is wonderful too.

Had the whole sea bass, mussels, octopus special, and spring onions. They were all fresh, delicious, and clean flavors. The staff are fantastic. Don t skip on the dessert. The pot di creme and this Meyer lemon mousse something rather were both amazing!

I wish we could have ordered one of every dish but will just have to come back! They were incredibly accommodating for dietary restrictions, and while the menu may not specifically state gluten free options, the choices were abundant. We will absolutely be back.

Excellent restaurant, I would highly recommend it. If youre prepared to spend a bit more than your usual meal out, this place is awesome. The food was on top and the staff was great. So many good options from the menu. Its a good idea to share the food so that you can taste more plates. The atmosphere is dynamic and slightly noisy with people chatting but if you dont mind it, it all actually works out to a great atmosphere. Deserts on top too, I would give you a recommendation but I think that youre safe if you just trust the waitress

I have never wanted to lick a plate so desperately in my life I had the salmon feature and from the artful presentation to the mouthwatering flavours- I was smitten It was quite literally the best salmon that I have ever tasted. It was succulent, moist, flavourful & melted in my mouth. They further maximized the flavour with a crispy skin finish that gave a hightened texture and finish that was utterly swoon worthy The service is ALWAYS top notch and you ll often find the owners there, nimbly sliding in to bus tables (ahem - Brad  ) and have a friendly word The wine selection is also top notch and if you re not sure what you want, Kyle is there to assist in marrying a vino to your palate with exquisite accuracy 5 Stars all the way

Excellent Celiac Safe meal at Oddfish!  Really impressed with the attentiveness of the wait staff, the care taken when dealing with a medically needed diet and the nice outdoor atmosphere!  It is better to sit outside as inside is very loud.  Outside is still loud but traffic dependant. Vegetarian options: The menu is heavy plant / vegetarian / seafood oriented.  Despite not being a vegetarian the food was outstanding for flavour! Dietary restrictions: Celiac Disease / Gluten free diet - very accommodating and understood ins and outs of diet needs (such as sweet potato chips fried in oil in pan instead of fryer) and cross contamination.  Another Celiac dining at next table.  Chocolate mousse desert was outstanding! Wheelchair accessibility: One floor.  Did not check washrooms.  We sat outside and let them know that I needed an accessible table and a very suitable one was provided.  The tables are pretty tight together so it was good to warn them.

Food is absolutely delactable. Highlights for me were the fungi linguini and lemon posit. Although for the linguini we opted no wine due to the kids as they dont like the taste, olive oil replacement was just as amazing. Service is warm and friendly. Environment is noisy once it fills up as quite a few tables tend to carry very animated conversations so not for folks who enjoy a serene dining experience.

This is a new seafood restaurant that just opened in the Kitsilano neighbourhood. The seafood is incredibly fresh and delicious. My suggestion is to come to this restaurant and share the dishes family style between 3 to 4 people. This gives you an opportunity to try a bit of everything on the menu. Our favourite dishes were the fresh burrata, grilled octopus with spicy romanesco puree and the pasta with chanterelle mushrooms. So insanely good. The wine selection was also very reasonable with a mix of local and international wines. Definitely worth trying out if you are in the mood for great seafood.
So glad we were able to get a table here - the food was incredible and the service was very friendly. A must try!
Both fish were perfectly cooked along with the pasta being perfectly Al dente. The pesto pasta was especially delicious.
I found the food really good. Fresh ingredients and skillful preparation. Drinks were really good too. The waiters were lovely too, however they forgot to bring the 2nd drink I ordered :D.

We had not just an incredible dinner here, but also a magnificent dining experience. The restaurant has an ever-changing specials menu based on what s fresh from the sea. Two of us ordered the blood orange octopus carpaccio and it was to die for. Mains were delicious too- thai mussels, scallops and piccata. The ambiance here is fantastic- and the service was amazing. Our server and sommelier really knew the menu & had excellent pairing suggestions. We will 1000% be back. What a fantastic evening
Best spot for seafood! Oysters and mussels were delicious. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Definitely will be coming back!

I ve been here many times before but only a few times by myself. This time as a solo diner I was sat at the table by the kitchen. My server was so amazing, she didn t make me feel rushed cause I was solo dining. The food was amazing. Wanted to thank the chefs personally but they were so busy. I ll definitely be back for solo dining and with friends. The watermelon salad was amazing

Absolutely phenomenal! My better half and I celebrated a new chapter last Thursday and we couldnt be happier with this dining experience. We started with some oysters that were both fresh and delicious. Our server, Lisa, was exceptional at describing specials and welcoming us into her section. Although it was her section, the entire team worked beautifully together at making sure eveey guests was attended to. We selected our meals from the feature menu and highly recommend it. Our appie was the Burrata, and it was spectacular. Paired with our white wine, on their heated patio was heavenly. We shared the Branzino feature and it was light, soft and cooked to perfection. We wanted to ensure a compliment to the cook was sent as it blew our minds. Well done Jonah. If youve got room for dessert, do it. Everything this Odd Fish does is remarkable.

Great food and service was excellent. Staff was always there to fill your water and take away the dirty dishes. Our server offered us more toasted bread to soak up the broth from the mussels. Its thoughtful gestures like that, that is often missing from restaurants these days. . Dishes are shareable and theres a good variety. The menu is more than what is on their webpage as they have a seasonal menu with quite a few dishes in addition to there regular menu. The inside seating sounded noisy so we chose to sit outside.Outdoor patio is enclosed and heated.
The best Branzino I have ever had! I highly recommend Oddfish for anyone looking for delectable fresh seafood raw or cooked to perfection.
Great seafood, veggie restaurant. Server really helpful with menu and wine list. Bit out of downtown where we were staying, but well worth the $10 Uber.

A must-try restaurant for any seafood lover! They ve got all the classics as well as great tapas style dishes that will make your mouth water just by reading them up on the menu. It s definitely on the pricey side so this is not your everyday go-to restaurant (unless you re in the 1%, in which case please have dinner there every night!) but rather saved for special occasions.

Simply delicious and fresh. Burrata with romesco sauce and olives served with toasted bread. Whets the appetite. The bread had a nice bite that complemented the cheese. Seared scallops with cauliflower puree. That cauliflower was so smooth! Clams served with toasted bread. Flavourful garlic and chilis wine broth was perfect. Olive oil cake. Light lemon flavour and the right amount of sweetness served with creme fraiche and macerated blueberries. It was a lovely dinner with wonderful food and great customer service. Will certainly be back.
Everything was excellent! We had 2 oysters each, fanny bay, they were delicious. Same goes for their mussels and fries. Well save a bit of appetite to order their desserts next time.
Easily my favourite restaurant in the city. Fresh sheet always offers something new to try, along with regular menu staples that hit the spot every time. Awesome staff!
Another strong recommendation would like seafood and you are in Vancouver. This place is fabulous seafood dishes. Highly recommend it!

I have travelled to many countries and sampled many restaurants. I have to say that the Oddfish experience was simply divine..food was incredible..server (anthony) an absolute gem. It was an moment that allowed us..the 7 of us to stop/reflect and come to the same conclusion..that was a materpiece of a meal..i feel honoured and privilged to say that i have dined in vancouvers finest seafood restaurant..it will always be a fond memory back in galway, ireland.
A fantastic seafood restaurant with expert staff and delicious food. Our server helped us craft a tapas menu that was a delicious culinary experience. Thank you!
The oysters were so delicious, they tasted fresh out of the ocean! I appreciate that they serve non-alcoholic cocktails too.

Delicious! The food is absolutely awesome here. We loved the Hot Mess dish and the pistachio crusted sturgeon! The salted caramel desert was also superb. You ll be impressed with mostly anything you order here. Waiters are very friendly and knowledgable. Listen to them and their suggestions. A little on the expensive side but worth the indulgence.
Hands down some of the best food weve had in a very long time. Highly recommend!
This is amazing restaurant. Some of the finest seafood dishes I have ever had. The service was great too.
Wow... Order family style. Food is a little pricey, smaller portions but its fantastic. This was worth the splurge!
Fantastic service, drinks and above all, fantastic food!

Odd fish restaurant takes pride in what they do! Love this place. Fresh and tasty seafood dishes with excellent service. We ordered the fresh oysters, mussels and fries and then the potato crusted halibut as well as the sole piccata. They were all so good that now it s stuck in my head and palate for such great foods. Our server was also outstanding. Totally recommend.

Amazing seafood! Hands down the freshest mussels I ve ever had. The fish entree was also fabulous with crispy skin. The prawn ceviche was quite acidic but still delicious. Oysters were juicy and fresh. I only wish the waiter was more warm and welcoming.
Great seafood and fantastic service! Get the Seafood Hot Mess - its perfection on a plate. Also awesome, a place in Vancouver that serves dry sherry by the glass.
Service was amazing and food was incredible. If you like seafood, this is the place for it.
Awesome menu. I personally recommend the burratta. You can ask for some changes in the plates. Very nice waitress.

The service was great. The Google reviews are right! The light that comes in from the big windows and decor of the place is realy nice even though we were there on a rainy evening. The patio was covered and still open which was surprising! Good to know for next time. We had the spaghetti with tomatoes and basil on special and it was so good. You could tell the pasta was fresh and made in house as they say. It was also very al dente which is what I like a lot about fresh pasta! We also ordered the squid the whole seabass with the harissa sauce. I personally didnt think too much of the seabass as I think I just prefer harissa with more heat but thats just me. The other highlight of our meal was the parsley salad that came with the whole fish. It was SO Good. Like literally a light fresh tangy surprise in your mouth thats like the best contrast after taking a couple bites of the fish. So refreshing. So yum! Id come back for the pasta and am looking forward to trying nook. Our awesome server told us their sister restaurant nook does the daily fresh meat pastas while oddfish does the seafood ones. So excited, I hope they have some parsley salad over there too lol
I am glad we found this restaurant! Fresh and delicious food, excellent service, warm atmosphere. Super!
Food and service were both great! Been here a few times now. :) Would recommend

The staff are friendly and never steer you wrong with suggestions. The food is delicious and the wine selections are well curated. If seated in the dining room, as is always a packed house, tends to be a little loud.
Great Food and Ambiance. The service by Tony was exceptional as well.

Oddfish was a great experience overall! Excellent food with lots of different dishes to try, fantastic service that was genuinely helpful, and a lively atmosphere. We shared about 6 different dishes and liked all of them! Awesome spot for a special occasion, youll have to make a reservation.
Delicious seafood, Friendly Staff, Great Ambiance and Punchy Cocktails!

Server coped with our frequent changes of numbers easily. Food was excellent especially main dish of sole recommended by the server. Lovely location on the patio. Second time we ve eaten here and will reserve every time we visit Vancouver.
This is by far one of the best in the city. The food is delicious and the service is friendly. A neighborhood fav. I highly recommend it for a nice  evening out. Food
Love odd fish. Great food, great service & a vibey place

10/10 would recommend Weve been here on multiple occasions and always leave impressed and completely satisfied with the quality of the food and the service. The menu continuously changes but it is always great includes GF, DF options. Great for sharing with a group of people or for a business dinner. Love the heated outdoor patio for the summer/ winter.

Three varieties of oysters on the half shell. Great beet salad, truffle sole was excellent, crudo delicious, very nice Thai mussels. Wonderful house marinated olives. Great service. Half eggplant was unevenly cooked, the mixed texture combined with the simple BBQ sauce was underwhelming. We will be back worth a visit. Thanks

Nice cozy place on the corner and was quitr busy on a Saturday evening. Good that a booking was made so I could sit on a table. If not, would have been on the bar counter.. Amazing variety of sea food and I LOVED almost everything. Despite living in a hoise close to beach on a tropical country, I thoroughly enjoyed the dishes and the variety. Price was on the high side but good value for money..

Just wow!  Our server was amazing.  She was very attentive and knew what our needs were before we had to ask for anything. She was very prepared as she knew the specials and menu items intimately and communicated it perfectly to us.  I should have taken a picture of the daily specials as we ordered some from that menu and they were amazing.  The regular menu items were also really good.   We we definitely go back and try more of everything there!  Next time I will do a better job capturing the details of what we had.

Really nice restaurant and menu if you like fish, with fully vegetarian options too. If the chef is reading: I would personally use something finer and softer as the crunchy element in the Leches de Tigre Ceviche. But really nice and agreeable, certainly to be experienced.

Have dined here 3 times in the last couple years and each time is fantastic. I didn t even notice until last night that they don t even have meat on the menu. No one including my meat loving husband missed it though! The burrata as a starter is a must have. I ve had both the honey pistachio and the seasonal pea mint one. Perfect. I didn t even like burrata before this. The fresh pasta makes a nice side dish with a veggie side too. We shared the halibut but I could have eaten it all! For dessert we had the salted caramel bowl of heaven (not actual name). The only other dessert I ve had elsewhere that is better than this is the date pudding at Rim Rock Cafe. Beyond the food, the servers are all very friendly and attentive. The vibe is  as casual or as dressy as you want .  Very Vancouver. I d you make a reso for the patio know that most of it is covered/enclosed from rain and there are heaters, I was warmer out there than I often feel indoors!

Great seafood spot in Vancouver. We especially lived the Halibut Crudo and the Mussels. Everything was excellent. Nothing too fancy or novel but everything was very fresh and tasty. Nice ambience too.
Grilled oysters are to die for, great vibe and excellent service.
Some of the best seafood i ve had in some time. Scott was a fabulous server, and my wife and thoroughly enjoyed the mussels and tuna tataki that he recommended. We ll definitely be back!
The best seafood I eaten in the west coast over the last 7 years. Really fresh, cooked to perfection.
Great recommendation from a lady on the street, we had a great time and really enjoy the food

Food: Food was great. The mushroom gravy with baguette was fantastic, and they brought out extra baguettes upon our request. We also had their 2 daily specials market fish, sea bass and ocean perch which were both very nice. We also had their fresh dozen oysters and vongole pasta for 3 people. Their portion size is not that big, so we ordered a bunch and shared everything. Service: All staffs are attentive and polite. Our waitress went over the daily specials for us with as much detail as possible (herbs, sauce, whether the fish has bones or not, flavours). They seated us out in the patio despite walking in without any reservations. Despite going off on the menu + wine, our will came out to be less than what we expected. (I guess we overestimated the market price).

Super flavorful. Good amount of food. Absolutely delicious. We got 6 oysters, two apps, and two mains...that was too much food for us but it was hard to stop because of how good it was! Highly recommend
Amazing service and hands down one of the best seafood restaurants in kits.

Very good selection of seasonal seafood thats cooked to perfection. The drinks are wonderful as well. Their open kitchen concept is really  fascinating and fun to watch, especially watching all the prep work. Overall ambiance of the restaurant  is great and weve always had friendly staff. Really recommend getting the oysters.
Wasn t a fan of pasta before until I had Mushroom Linguine  bonus-it has some spice perfectly to my taste. For sure will go back and order few to go
A+ great meal, fresh fish, impeccable service. Kinda pricey cocktails but food is spot (praw)on.
We had dinner there for the first time and it was amazing , the food was great , staff were friendly , for sure will go back

Went here before going to Bard on the Beach.  Great restaurant easily within walking distance to the event. Wonderful outside seating area with complimentary blankets if you get cold. great fish selection and everything that came out of the kitchen looked and tasted superb. not cheap but I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a good meal.  My only complaint was a lackluster filet job on the sea bass we ordered (dodging bones is never fun) but the flavors of everything were fantastic.

My meat-loving fiance and I enjoyed an incredible early Valentines Date this week. We shared 3 dishes including the mouth watering scallops and perfectly balanced pasta - to ensure we saved room for their salted caramel dessert... highly recommend! Relaxed, comfortable service and delicious cocktails made the night one to remember. We can t wait to go back!

Five star service and food here! Unique menu and interesting dishes. Make sure you try their drinks -- best Ive ever had. Everything tastes like heaven here. Staff are so friendly, thoughtful, above and beyond. They treat you like a rockstar that you wish you could stay forever. The service totally completes the dining experience here. Good for both groups and dating. Highly recommended and make sure you mark them down on your to go list when you are in Kits.
Amazing food, best seafood and freshest oysters in town! Great atmosphere and friendly service. The kitchen bar is the best seats to get a view of the action!

The is where to go for great, fresh fish. If fish is not your thing, then this is the wrong spot for you. We had the Hot Mess, a medley of different seafood, all of it excellent. We shared appies, one of prawns and one of squash. Both were delicious. We should have added some side dishes with the Hot Mess to round out the meal but it was still really good. Friendly, informative service. Good wine list and a very nice modern space.
The Hey Sailor and delicious potato wrapped halibut were incredible. Thank you!
Absolutely fantastic food. I highly recommend it.

I have a bunch of food allergies, so its tough for me to eat out sometimes. These folks were *so fantastic,* the head chef even came out to chat with me, and let me know that the dressing on one of the salads was mayo-based, and collaborate on how to make it differently delicious. The food was *so incredible.* Peak-fresh veggies and fish, beautifully prepared, and perfectly cooked. I highly recommend Oddfish.
Food was delicious! Would come back here next time! Kid-friendliness: Yes. Very nice and kind to kids Food : 5/5 |

A night to remember. Was my birthday and all the specialty items were to die for. Our server was one of a kind and very personable. Very attentive to making sure we had drinks full and bellys full. Thank you for an amazing experience.

Favourite restaurant in Vancouver! My top recommendation for sharing several plates with a few friends! Thats just the way to go at oddfish because you will want everything on the menu plus a few of the many features!! I have absolutely loved everything I have ever eaten here. Creativity prepared fresh seasonal veggies, and seafood! I always feel blown away by something seemingly simple but prepared so deliciously with flavours I wouldn t expect! I love that there are always new tasty features, always expect seafood prepared a little different. The burrata is also perfection. Great oysters and pastas too! The staff and management are so kind, always accommodating, recognize us and give excellent service. Not too fancy but doesn t feel weird to dress up for. Thank you Oddfish!

Great service from an experienced team that all work together to ensure you are well cared for. Everything is freshly prepared and the flavours compliment the fish very nicely. Wine selection is succinct and the servers are knowledgeable in pointing you towards the right pairing. A great experience all around!

Every single aspect of this meal was 5 star; dinner, apps, wine, server,  ambiance.  Yellowfin crudo melts in your mouth. Chicken Sauce roasted snapper was full of flavour. Best meal weve had in a while.

What a great spot. Innovative menue that was absolutely delightful and tasty. We had mussels in spicy lemongrass coconut milk. Excellent. Roasted cauliflower was perfect. Shared a pasta in pesto dried tomatoe sauce. A touch dry but again very tasty. Casual but busy location nice wine choices and cocktails. Will be back.

A hidden gem in Kitsilano. Amazing seafood, drinks and service. They also totally nailed the dining experience despite the pandemic restrictions. Nice work! Just a tip, if you want to have your selection of everything on the menu, go early - they have sold out of items all three times that I ve been there.

Went here prior to a Bard on the Beach performance and absolutely loved it. The grilled octopus was the best we have ever had, and the mussels in coconut broth were also excellent. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for high quality seafood dishes showcasing the best of the west coast.

Hamachi and ceviche dishes really stood out. The sea bass was also great, you can really taste the grill flavour. I did not care for the octopus dish as I found the flavours were not to my liking but some may like it. Great French fries and bread. Top service
